column5: TIGHT is the operative word...but love them!
column6:
These are TIGHTS. Not leggings.

I put these on and was like....WHAAAA? Holiday turkey? Too much pie? OMG. Thought, shoot, maybe I need the next size up. Not kidding, was kind of freaking out. What is the world coming to? Or for that matter, my lower half?
Then I tried them a second time and was more into the feel. These are reportedly "hugged sensation." If hugged by an anaconda is your kind of hug, then yes.
These are supportive, not loose and comfy. They ARE comfy don't get me wrong. But these are what you wear when you want your legs and booty to be all cinched in. My boyfriend said, "Those are amazing and you look tiny." OK. SOLD.
Then I ran in them. I LOVED how they worked on a cold day to keep muscles supported and warm. These pants are legit technical gear. Now that I think of them more like compression gear, I understand the fit.
DO wear these out running. DON'T wear these out to an all you can eat buffet. Save that for a pair of Wonder Unders. :)

BUT I can't help myself, they have tons of pockets, and on cold days that means I can carry chapstick and tissues, and keep my phone in the pocket instead of having to put it in the pocket of my tank or shirt. They do not slide down while running even though they are mid rise! That's a rarity for me, so that kinda sold me on them since it is nice to just run without having to tug on my clothes.
Details: I'm 5"5", waist 34", hips 45.5" -Curvy but muscular, and most of my weight is in my butt and thighs. The sizing seemed to vary in the colors I bought:
Etch Hail Midnight Navy which I bought on WMTM in size 10 and it was a tiny bit tighter getting on than the radiant multi. Even though they're white inside (LULU!! you gotta stop that) they still look good despite being slightly faded over the front of my thighs. THEY DO NOT PASS THE BEND OVER TEST. I don't care because I bought them for running and maybe will wear for spin classes, but I won't use for bootcamps because they're def not squat proof. Although if you wear a thong no one will probably notice, lol.
Radiant Multi is definitely tighter than Rip Wave Purple Thunder Black which I bought in an 8. The 8 feels the same, maybe a tiny bit more compressive than the radiant multi in size 10, but they don't fade as much over the thighs so I'm keeping them. The Radiant Multi is too light on the inside so it really stretches over the front of my thighs causing fade. But I don't care. I love them too much. I do prefer the way the 8s fit in the Rip Wave Purple ones, and I initially bought an 8 in the Radiant Multi, but I couldn't get them over my thighs.
I'll update if they lose some stars due to quality issues which many other seemed to have had. Because this is my first run tight purchase at Lulu, I can't compare them to the previous versions.

column5: Chemical smell and poor quality. But they look fantastic.
column6:
I usually love lulu's leggings. I have two pairs that have been staple pieces for three years. They look great and I love the pockets. I've been a huge fan of Lululemon for years, and this was my first time ordering from Lululemon online. Never again.
When I opened the package, I immediately smelled a pungent chemical odor but figured it would fade away with time and a wash. The second time I wore these (before washing them), the threads began to unravel, it's not a big deal, but I've sewed them back into the seam twice already in several locations. Disappointing because this pair costs over a hundred dollars and require so much maintenance while my older pairs have held up perfectly.
It's been almost a month since I got them. I've washed them three times on gentle for the sole purpose of getting the smell out and I've even tried laying them in the sun for six hours. Nothing's changed in terms of smell, and I can't wear them out of the house because I've had two people mention the strong odor.
I might have gotten a lemon, but I've given up on this pair. Don't buy these unless you try them on in the store first, and don't assume the smell will fade away.

column6: I LOVE MY LULULEMON LEGGINGS. I HAVE AN OBSESSION AND USUALLY AM THE FIRST TO DEFEND THE PRICE POINT DUE TO HOW LONG THEY LAST AND THE GREAT QUALITY (ESPECIALLY COMPARED TO NIKE); HOWEVER, I JUST GOT THESE IN THE MAIL A FEW DAYS AGO AFTER ORDERING THEM ONLINE AND AFTER GOING FOR ONE RUN IN THEM HAVE ALREADY NOTICED LOOSE THREADS ON THE SEEMS. I AM DISAPPOINTED AND HOPE THAT THEIR QUALITY IS NOT BEING SACRIFICED.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Yikes, I’m sorry to hear that your seams are unravelling. We stand behind the quality of our gear and would love to make this right. Keep an eye out for an email headed your way.\nyour way.', 'LL_response_date': 'August 18, 2017'}

column6: I loved these pants so much, they look great on me however, similar to other comments by the 2nd /3rd rush I noticed that the seems began to unravel. They also began to pilling in the butt, quad, and knee area. These pants were among the first items I bought from lululemon. To be honest, I was always hesitant because of the cost. However I heard that the quality and life span of the products made the cost well worth it. I was disappointed that this happened.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey CTsweatenthusiast,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'August 16, 2017'}

column6: I purchased these pants in store about 8 months ago, I was so excited about the pockets that I just couldn't resist. The first few times I wore them they were wonderful, but then after washing them twice the stitching began to come out on places in the legs. I also wore them to my gymnastics coaching job and after one practice of sitting on the carpeted floor the butt started to pill, which is very noticeable now. I have heard so many great things about how well Lululemons pants last and I was disappointed that they began showing wear within two wears. Really wish these pants were more sturdy and didn't show wear so early:(

We stand behind the quality of our gear and would love to make this right. Keep your eye out for an email headed your way.', 'LL_response_date': 'August 15, 2017'}

column6: I am so glad Lululemon came out with these, they are one of my all time favorite pants!!! They slim my thighs and make my butt look fantastic. Love the fabric, for some reason the grey ones seemed to be the stretchiest fabric out of the other colors. I tried them on in store and brought them home and the grey color looks great with ALL my workout tops! I was worried about the pockets looking weird, but they don't stand out as much as a thought which I liked. These might end up being my favorite pants!!!

This is my first pair of Lululemon tights and overall I do really enjoy them. They hold me in and they are GREAT for running. I so far have only had two issues. The first one being I only bought them yesterday and wore them to go on a run and I saw that the threading on the inseam was already coming apart so I cut it off because I already took off the tag so I can't exchange them >.<. The second issue is that they do slide down a lot. It can get annoying when I'm alternating between running and walking on the treadmill, but I do think that they are a great product.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi KayceeFL,\nSorry to hear that you're experiencing some issues with your Speed Up Tight. We've sent an email your way to connect more about your experience.\nChat soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'August 14, 2017'}

column6: Thank you Lulu for offering a regular rise again!! I am over the high waist pants. These fit and flatter my body perfectly

I bought these pants a while back when they had ruching on the side, and I absolutely loved them. They were tight in all the right places, made my butt look GREAT, and held up very well. I was so excited to get my second pair, due to all the constant wear of my old ones, and I purchased these. I expected the same fit and feel as the last pair as they were both speed tights, and I was excited about the mesh detail, but they got saggy very quickly, and immediately pilled around the crotch and inner thighs. I still wear them, as they are comfortable, and I love all my other lululemon, but this pair was disappointing.
